parsedContentPreview: {"id":"lesson-egy-001","title":{"arabic":"الخطوة الأولى في المصري","english":"First Steps in Egyptian Arabic","transliteration":"Al-khatwa al-oola fil masry"},"level":"beginner","description":{"arabic":"في الدرس ده هنتعلم أساسيات العامية المصرية: إزاي تسلم، وتقدم نفسك، وتسأل عن الحال.","english":"In this introductory lesson, you will learn the absolute essentials of Egyptian Arabic: how to say hello, introduce yourself, and ask someone how they are doing using the correct gender forms."},"learningObjectives":["Greet people naturally in Egyptian Arabic","Introduce yourself using 'I am' and 'My name is'","Ask 'How are you?' to both males and females","Respond to 'How are you?' appropriately"],"estimatedDuration":20,"prerequisites":[],"subLessons":[{"id":"sub-01","title":{"arabic":"التحية والأسماء","english":"Greetings and Names","transliteration":"El-taheya wal-asmaa"},"content":{"title":{"arabic":"كلمات الترحيب والتعارف","english":"Welcome and Introduction Words","transliteration":"Kalimat el-tarheeb wal-taarof"},"phrases":[{"arabic":"أهلاً","english":"Hello / Welcome","transliteration":"Ahlan"},{"arabic":"أنا","english":"I","transliteration":"Ana"},{"arabic":"اسمي","english":"My name","transliteration":"Esmy"},{"arabic":"انتَ","english":"You (masculine)","transliteration":"Inta"},{"arabic":"انتِ","english":"You (feminine)","transliteration":"Inti"},{"arabic":"اسمك ايه؟","english":"What is your name? (to a male)","transliteration":"Esmak eh?"},{"arabic":"اسمك ايه؟","english":"What is your name? (to a female)","transliteration":"Esmik eh?"}],"explanations":[{"english":"In Arabic, the word for 'You' changes depending on whether you are speaking to a male (Inta) or a female (Inti). 'Ana' (I) stays the same for everyone."}]},"exercises":[{"id":"ex-01","type":"matching","question":{"english":"Match the Egyptian Arabic word to its English meaning.","arabic":"وصل الكلمة بمعناها"},"options":[{"arabic":"أنا","english":"I","transliteration":"Ana","isCorrect":true},{"arabic":"ا
